resources.string: A ConstraintLayout is a ViewGroup which allows you to position and size widgets in a flexible way.
LinearLayout is a view group that aligns all children in a single direction, vertically or horizontally. You can specify the layout direction with the android:orientation attribute.
RelativeLayout is a view group that displays child views in relative positions. The position of each view can be specified as relative to sibling elements or in positions relative to each other.
A FrameLayout with a rounded corner background and shadow.
A view group that allows the view hierarchy placed within it to be scrolled. Scroll view may have only one direct child placed within it.
GridView is a ViewGroup that displays items in a two-dimensional, scrollable grid. The grid items are automatically inserted to the layout using a ListAdapter.
